page.title: 04EARLY POTATOES
page.content:
Behind L'Etacq Woodcrafts is a fertile area of sloping land where over the years the earliest of Jersey's early potatoes are grown. Each year these slopes produce a good crop of Jersey Royals and nine times out of ten they are the first to reach market.
There is no logical reason for this. The soil is the same as the soil in other parts of the Island. The cotils face the same way as other cotils in the Island which are used for early potatoes. The seed potatoes are sown at the same time as the others but almost every year the potatoes are the first to be harvested.
Why is this?
